error.signature: Node not joining the EKS cluster: nodes are NotReady
error.regex: (Node .+ NotReady|nodes are not joining|NodeCreationFailure|couldn't join cluster)

verdict.summary: EKS worker nodes fail to register with the control plane due to IAM, networking, or aws-auth ConfigMap issues.

dead_ends.action: Terminate and re-launch nodes without fixing the root cause
dead_ends.why_fails: New nodes will have the same misconfiguration and fail to join identically

dead_ends.action: Upgrade the EKS control plane version to fix node joining
dead_ends.why_fails: Version upgrades can make things worse if node AMI is incompatible with the new control plane version

workarounds.action: Verify aws-auth ConfigMap includes the node IAM role ARN
workarounds.how: kubectl get configmap aws-auth -n kube-system -o yaml and ensure the node role ARN is listed under mapRoles

workarounds.action: Check node security group allows communication with the control plane
workarounds.how: Ensure node security group allows outbound 443 to the cluster endpoint and inbound from the cluster security group

leads_to.condition: Node IAM role lacks required EKS permissions

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Fargate task failures are serverless container issues; EKS node not joining is about EC2-based worker node registration with the cluster
